New Records: LaMelo Ball joined some rather elite company in Steph Curry (5x) as the second NBA player to ever record 30+ 3-pointers in his team’s first six games of the season.
Key Match Events: The Hornets ripped off a 17-2 run in the opening four minutes of the third, quickly slicing Boston’s lead from 18 down to three.
Boston capitalized on the size advantage to win the glass by 10 (44-34) and scored efficiently in the pick-and-roll.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no specific pre-game insights in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Hornets Head Coach Charles Lee said, "I’m extremely happy with the group that came to the floor in the second half. We won the second half by eight points. There are no consolation prizes or anything, but the competitive level we had to get back into the game… I thought in the first half, we actually had some pretty good looks. The Celtics did a good job just punishing us for a bad rotation or a bad execution on a pick-and-roll coverage. They capitalized on a lot of those opportunities. In the second half, we just did a better job of tightening the screws."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brandon Miller returned to the court after missing the team’s past four games with a left glute strain and finished the game with 16 points on 6-of-18 shooting (10 points on 4-of-10 in the second half), four rebounds, and six assists, one shy of tying his career best.
The Hornets will head north for a one-game trip to face the new-look Minnesota Timberwolves on Monday, Nov. 4 beginning at 9 PM ET on the FanDuel Sports Network.
Others: The free-throw discrepancy was significant and decisive, with Boston knocking down 25-of-28 attempts (89.3%), while Charlotte went only 6-of-9 (66.7%; all in the first half).
